thread.title: Stocks That Were In News On October 13, 2015
thread.title_full: Stocks That Were In News On October 13, 2015

title: Stocks That Were In News On October 13, 2015
text:
Updated: Tuesday, October 13, 2015, 15:50 [IST] Facebook Twitter Google+ Comments Mail 
The Sensex ended the day at 26846.53, lower by 57.58 points or by -0.21 per cent and the NSE Nifty was at 8131.70 down by 11.90 points or by -0.15 per cent. 
On the global front, Asian markets ended the day lower, while most of Europe was trading with losses, following poor Chinese trade data. 
Yes Bank 
Yes Bank becomes the first Indian bank to be selected in Dow Jones Sustainability Indices in the emerging market index. 
The stock ended the day at Rs 733.75, higher by 1.29 per cent on BSE. It touched an intraday high Rs 736 during the trade. 
Suven Life 
Suven Life Sciences said that the company has received patents in Australia, China, Europe, South Korea and USA to their New Chemical Entities (NCE's) for CNS therapy through mechanism of action - H3 Inverse agonist. 
The stock ended the day at Rs 290.50, higher by 4.16 per cent on BSE. It touched an intra-day high Rs 295 during the trade. 
Mahindra & Mahindra 
Mahindra & Mahindra had been assigned BBB- rating with stable outlook by Standard & Poor's Rating Service. 
The stock ended the day at Rs 1283, higher by 0.61 per cent on BSE. It touched an intra-day high Rs 1289 during the trade. 
Reliance Capital 
Reliance Capital rose after the company said that Nippon Life Insurance has increased its stake in Reliance Capital Asset Management (RAMC) from existing 35 per cent to 49 per cent. 
The stock ended the day at Rs 400, higher by 5.15 per cent on BSE. It touched an intraday high Rs 403 during the trade. 
Cox & Kings 
Cox & Kings said that it has acquired UK-based hotel booking website LateRooms.com from travel major TUI Group for GBP 8.5 million. 
The stock ended the day at Rs 244.80, lower by 0.91 per cent on BSE. It touched an intraday high Rs 256 during the trade. 
Goodreturns.in
